text: I’m in Lineville, AL. My first inspection appointment was in early July 2020. He took pictures and measurements and recommended some things we could do to make the foundation more secure. I was told to expect a quote with pictures on Monday. After not hearing anything from him for 3 MONTHS after emailing him through the website and leaving messages on the office answering machine. I Finally heard back from Matt on October 14th, and I agreed to another inspection with him bringing along another smaller sized worker that would be able to inspect the entire crawl space. Second inspection was November 5th 2020, they were very polite and found a few more things that could be improved. I was told to expect a quote on Friday. It is now January 17th and I have not heard anything from this company. Very frustrating and I will not be using them in the future.

name: Carrie Richardson
text: Always professional, honest and helpful. Very thankful for their solutions! I’ve used Matt and his team twice now personally.

name: Jennifer Johnson
text:
I highly recommend Matt Caudle and his team. They were a pleasure to work with! That is really saying something, given the gravity of my foundation Issues.
The foundation was cracking, racking, and flooding with every rain. The repair was not a straightforward job, as the damage was really severe.
Matt walked me through the entire process with excellent communication. He is trustworthy and honest.
When the Sheetrock was removed and wall fully exposed, A major prior attempt to repair wall was revealed.  Bulging of wall was significant.
Matt and team made a plan to remove existing wall supports by section, ensuring the safety of the project.
5 Additional steel beams were needed, for a total of 13 Steel beams and 10 helical tie backs.  The ability to problem solve and secure the wall in this state was impressive. I was very pleased with the way the whole repair was handled.  The end result looks very nice!
Matt gave me an unexpected discount on the additional beams, which was going a step beyond.
The excellent communication with Matt and team made even this “difficult” job go smoothly.
The crew arrived daily on time, worked hard, and the job was completed in the stated time frame.
Matt and his dad have built a company that does excellent work and truly cares about the customer.
I would recommend them to any friend or family member. Thank you Matt Caudle and team!

name: Garland Caudle
text:
RESPONSE TO MR. JAMES MARDIS REVIEW: Southern-Home Structural Specialists was employed to stabilize a rear corner of the foundation wall that had settled prior to the purchase of the home by Mr. Mardis. Shortly after Mr. Mardis did purchase & move into the home, he called and stated that we had damaged the drain line and causing water to enter into the basement through the wall. This could only be his assumption due to the fact that the drain line was buried and covered with soil and not visible to see the assumed damages. Once the soil was removed and the wall exposed, by a waterproofing contractor hired by Mr. Mardis, there were no visble damaged to the wall or drain line. However, there was a visble horizontal crack more than 10 feet in length within the wall which is consistent with soil shrinkage allowing a foundation wall to settle. The waterproofing contractor stated the foundation wall & the water drain lines were not damaged by our company and that the horizontal crack was the entry point of the water. After viewing the photographs, a local Structural Engineer stated that the crack within the wall was indeed an ongoing settlement problem and a entry point for water seepage into the  basement even prior to Mr. Mardis purchase of the home. He felt that the water seepage into the basement may have been a pre-existing condition prior to the home purchase and was not caused by the recent foundation wall repairs performed by this company.
Again , this company does regret that Mr. Mardis purchased a home with pre-existing water entry conditions, and feel that his assumed negative customer referral comments were not valid or truthful.

Garland Caudle, Proprietor

text: Don Kennedy and Sons has worked on my house twice.  The first time it was to correct a foundation "repair" that was botched by another company who would not cover their work. Unfortunately, a different corner of our house needed repair a couple years later, and I called Kennedy and Sons again.  They put in push piers and again tied the foundation to deep rocks.  It remains to be seen how this new work will stand the test of time, but based on the prior work, I'm confident that it will.  The price on the work was very good, and they got to it quickly and were done within a week.  They didn't mess up my property.  When they left, it was surprising to me how well they covered their work, given the amount of digging they'd done.

So, your text about it would take 7 working hrs under my house in April, 2017 to correct my original issue with my flooring, and the now hump in another area did and has not happened. I was here when your work team arrived and when then left. You told me while they were working under the house, you would be inside the house directing them and to make sure of leveling.  Well, you were not here to direct so none of that happened and nobody told me to call the office for anything. Attached, is where you try to blame the builder.  I hired you correct my original flooring issue well after the builder.  Your correction should have included ALL THE REPAIRS TO CORRECT my flooring issues whether it what the builder did or did not do RIGHT?  So, here we are 12 May 2017 with my original flooring issues still existing, sagging and humped flooring.  So, Where do we go from here?

name: William McNeese
text:
Don Kennedy and Sons just completed major structural repairs on a home in preparation for a home’s appraisal and inspection for closing. The work involved Foundation Support Piers under brick footings to fix cracks in brick veneer and Stable Lift Piers with 2x8 girders in the crawlspace to fix sagging floors.

Tony was referred to me by my real estate agent and he was absolutely fantastic. Tony came right on time when he said he would be there and his communications were prompt and professional. It was a pleasure to work with Tony during the proposal phase and the work itself. He is technically knowledgeable and dependable. I highly recommend him! He is the reason I contracted with Don Kennedy & Sons.

The foundation support piers did exactly what they were supposed to do. The stair step cracks in the brick closed right up as we had hoped. There was a little more impact to the yard and soil than I had expected, but not a major issue.

The Stable Lift Piers and 2x8 girders also did their job. They are not as elaborate of a solution as the adjustable “Smart Jacks” on top of poured concrete pads from AFS, but they do work and they are a little less expensive. I recommend that consumers understand what they are purchasing on major repairs like this and get someone to help if they don’t. I did an internship with a home inspector, and I have structural improvements at my main residence, so I was able to spot some minor issues which Tony readily and proactively agreed to correct once I explained them on the phone. The laborers came right over, understood my concerns, and fixed them right away. Some additional materials were added at no expense/no questions. I think if Tony had been available to inspect before I did he would have corrected these on his own. My own inspection was prematurely hurried by the office manager – see below.

Administratively this business has some improvements to make. At 2:00 on Friday I was called by the administrative assistant that my work was complete and asking for immediate payment. I kindly asked for a chance to see the work first over the weekend and that I would pay on my way to work first thing Monday morning. I was told that they would have to ask the office mgr. This made sense and I agreed. Surprisingly, Jordan called me back promptly explaining that this was not acceptable per her manager and that I needed to leave my own job and arrange for payment with Jordan ASAP. I immediately left a voice mail for Tony. Thankfully he straightened it all out. I was never given an apology by the office manager.

So, I ran over first thing Saturday morning to inspect and observed the minor corrections needed to be made. The office mgr’s insistence on paying right after they were done Friday seemed underhanded (and downright strange too), but Tony made it all right. The office manager needs to get better at being reasonable conducting business, treating people respectfully, and resolving business issues firsthand with customers. However, administrative assistant Jordan worked very hard to provide great, positive customer service. I remained with the laborers on Saturday to make sure everything was fixed to spec, and it was. The laborers worked hard and were very friendly.

I’d recommend to Don Kennedy and to their customers that a 7-10 business day payment period be part of the contract to allow the customer time to inspect repairs, Tony to inspect, and/or get a buddy to inspect after completion of the work. This will also take a lot of stress off the payment-hungry front office and the customer. I’ve contracted lots of work over the years and I’ve never been pressed for payment so urgently – despite a 50% down payment before starting the work.

In summary I do recommend Don Kennedy & Sons for residential structural repairs and especially if you work with Tony.

text:
We had our roof and gutters replaced by USA Roofing. Overall we are pleased with the quality of roof provided by their team. I will say there was challenges along the way but at the end of the day they made them right.

Pros of the job
Quality of information up front and materials used was better than average. They weren't pushy like several of the other contractors I met with prior to selecting USA Roofing. They also worked closely with me during the insurance claim process and made things very smooth on that end. Finally, once they got started, they quickly completed the job and left little to no evidence they were there once they cleaned up the work site.

Cons

Unfortunately they started the job on an afternoon when it rained heavily into the night which caused some water leaks overnight but they were quick to come out first thing the next day to get things dried up and secure. The crew also dropped a hammer through our dining room ceiling during the job but they quickly took ownership of the issue and made the repairs accordingly. Communication at times with the scheduling and completion of the work could have been better is the only other criticism I would have for their mgmt team. I chalk this up to how busy they were at this time as hundreds of homes in the Birmingham area we damaged during this massive hail storm and they had a lot of jobs in flight at the same time.

May 21: Richard and Zach did a great job stabilizing the foundation of my house to prevent further damage. Seed and hay have not been provided to cover the soil, I had to fill in a hole left in one area myself, and I have been ghosted since I paid the invoice. Dropping my 5 stars to 4. Update #2: Important note: If there is something you don’t like, talk to the foreman who did the work and not to the sales force. 5 stars to the crew that actually did the work, 3 stars to the AFS internal and external communication process.

He made an assessment of the whole landscape and explained to us our options taking into account changes we wanted to make to our property in the future.   He made recommendations to redirect water from gutters and other helpful suggestions, took time to answer all questions and explained the AFS guarantee.  He explained the process of raising the sidewalk and an appointment was made for one week later.
Brandon called ahead and arrived on time.  He asked if I had any questions and explained exactly what he would be doing.  The process took about 45 minutes and there was minimal cleanup he needed to do.
My husband and I have had work done by this company before.  The people are friendly and professional.   I would highly recommend AFS because they stand behind their work and train their people well.  Both men were just exceptional !!

name: Daniel Clements
text: In December 2020, I had my crawlspace fully encapsulated and sprayed with a cleaning agent.  From start to finish the process was smooth and transparent.  My main contact was Benjamin Worsham who was very honest and always responded to any questions quickly.  The install crew worked hard and did a great job.  I met with multiple companies and ultimately went with AFS due to their lifetime warranty, large service department for any future needs, and honest approach to my specific needs.  I had a relatively simple job = small crawlspace, only moderate moisture issues, and small amounts of mold but nothing severe yet which is what I wanted to prevent. name: Betty Pierce
text:
Some years ago we needed some significant waterproofing and structural repairs done in our basement home. We contacted a few different companies to provide an Inspection and estimate. After some discussion we decided
On a company that was not on the higher side of the estimates. We felt like the fix would be pretty much the same no matter who we chose
And saving money was in our interest at the time..One company we called was a fairly well known local company A.F.S. We were familiar with them because they began here in Decatur
So we would see trucks around town. FYI,  I wanted you to know, we should’ve called AFS from the start. Today I’m here some 7 odd years later, after spending thousands of dollars with the low price alternative and my
Sump pump and drainage system doesn’t work, our walls are blistering and cracking up, down and horizontally, water is seeping thru the wall cracks and the concrete blocks are shifting and cracking our exterior brick and interior block walls. I have limited mobility and couldn’t go check on these things easily and things kept getting worse. Considering what we received from the lower priced company, we decided to call AFS to provide their opinion on our basement situation. At this point , the only thing working or effective was a dehumidifier. It was time to seek experts advice. We had previously used AFS in a limited capacity for our cracked pool deck and they performed that repair just fine and although that repair is not inexpensive,
It was much less and more quickly usable than any other options we looked at. So from there we felt we could allow them a chance to tell us (what )was happening and (why )was it happening . When the day came for the inspection, David Flamm , the inspector called our home in advance and let us know his arrival time and asked if we could sit for a few questions before beginning the inspection. He felt we would have something of value to help  determine the cause of the damage. We felt he was sincere and listened to what we had to say and even wrote down the answers. We watched as he went room to room with his big light and something like a laser . He was very thorough, and  took  pictures as he moved around the house.
One thing he did,  that most never do, is David removed his boots before walking on my clean floors. Not a big thing but it got my attention.
After the inspection inside , he explained what he would be doing outside and that my husband
Was welcome to tag along if he wanted, so he did. He was rather impressed with David’s knowledge and ability to explain the plan of repair. After our experience with another company (who did almost nothing) and David’s attitude and attention to our concerns, we were very relieved that we called AFS. He took pictures and put them on his laptop for us to clearly see the issues, he asked our opinion and waited for our response. Never did he act pushy or lacked any uncertainty about what he would do to help us. He allowed us to view video software of the repairs needed, and even priced the project as he went thru the videos. Needless to say,  we were very comfortable with Dave and could feel he really knew what the problems required. Before we had to ask, David explained AFS Warranty, Service and maintenance program and how they return and maintain the eguipment so we didn't have to worry. This was very helpful considering my physical limitations and my husband is very busy with work. We felt very reassured after spending a couple of hours with David Flamm, we had called the right company. AFS must invest a lot of time into the people that work for them, it was so smooth . We had no trouble connecting the dots. David explained the project review process they go they prior to arriving to our home and how the foreman on the job has already seen the project and all of the pictures as David and the foreman discuss the ins and outs of it. It seems every concern we had initially was addressed before we had to express it. AFS, should be the first and only call you make for your home today.
We are glad we did.

resp.text: Hello Betty! Thank you for taking time to submit a review about your experience with our company. We appreciate your thoughtful, detailed account of how we were able to deliver great results. We take tremendous care to provide the highest level of service possible during every project—and it’s awesome to be recognized for our efforts. - AFS Foundation & Waterproofing Specialists

name: Patricia Flory
text:
Nathan, Garrett and Alfonso showed up at the scheduled time to begin 5 days of work to install French drains, a sump pump and dehumidifier along with a full basement crawl space encapsulation at my house. They were very prompt and courteous.  We had a small problem that Nathan brought to my attention after he and his crew started the prep work in the area which resulted in them having to remove 2 additional (early 1930's) brick support columns and level the dirt foundation under them.  Had Nathan not brought the potential problem to my attention, even with the work they were doing, I might have had more collapse in that area in the future.  Now I won't have any concerns about that.  I was very impressed with how well these 3 men worked together and also independently while completing the job.  AFS has turned an old damp 1930's basement crawl space area into a bright, clean space my grandkids could play in at my house.  The crew cleanup in my yard was spot-on.  They even hauled off those brick columns for me.  I'm looking forward to the follow-up visit in about two months to see how much more lift they can get in my (had been) sagging floors.  There was some immediate improvement when they tightened all the floor jacks and after that new dehumidifier dries up my floor rafters for a few weeks we should see even more improvement.  No more squeaky, rattling floors!!
Thank you, AFS.
Patricia

name: Tom Counts
text:
I had a problem with the 20 year old concrete in my carport settling and cracking. It had to be stabilized or I was going to have to totally redo the carport.  I did not know who to contact but a friend had AFS do some foundation stabilization work for him. I asked him about AFS.  I had seen the TV ads but know that anyone can do a slick tv commercial.  It turns out, the friend was positively impressed with AFS on his project. So, I made an appointment for their rep to visit.  I was still a little skeptical.  The field rep arrived on time and looked at my issue.  He suggested their concrete stabilization product.  He described how it would work and be installed.  He was not at all pushy nor did he give me any slick sales pitch.  He knew about the product, how it was installed and what it could do.  I agreed to do the project with them and made a down payment on the project.  We scheduled the job and on the agreed upon day, the installation crew arrived.  They were a little later than initially planned BUT the office called to say they were running behind, so that was not an issue.  They were maybe 30 minutes later than planned. The installation guys checked over the carport and talked over their plans with me. Then they went straight to work. They were clean cut, totally nice people to have at my home with no smoking or foul language - just hard work! There was an obvious difference to the carport when they were through.  So, I really felt good about their work.  They also cleaned up any mess that they made (a little concrete dust) with the tools they brought to the job site. Prior to this experience, I did not know this company,  other than my from friends recommendation & a TV commercial.  After my experience I would not hesitate to recommend them.
I give AFS an A+ & 5 stars!

resp.text: Mr. Counts, thank you for such a thorough review and recommendation! We are glad you had a pleasant experience and that the repair to your carport was installed to your satisfaction. Let us know if we can be of any further assistance.

text:
What a group of people and company!  I had a huge problem in my basement/crawlspace. Over the last 2 years, it has flooded during the heavy rains in January and February.  I did some research to evaluate this issue and decided to go with a reputable, established, and known company.  I was not disappointed.  Mr. David Flamm arrived at my house promptly for my initial appointment.  He was professional and personable.  After a few minutes of discussion, he understood my concerns and started his investigation.  Once he completed his investigation, he sat down my wife and I and went over his findings. His presentation of what could be done was easy to understand and follow along using the video clips on his computer. All seemed logical, but me, being the ever skeptic, asked many questions about how the system would work and why it seemed the water was infiltrating my living spaces after 7 years of no water. He answered all of my questions and his explanations made sense.  After it was all said and done, we had the Aquastop Control groundwater seepage system with Aquastop basement air system,  EZflow  tubing with the triple pump action installed.
Day of installation:
The team showed up on time for the install lead by Nick.  It had been raining a lot AGAIN and i had my makeshift sump-pump system running to dewater the area where it was building up.  The team laid down plastic tarp so as to not get my finished basement dirty and commenced to working.  It took them 2 days to complete.  What a job. When they laid in the pump system and started the pumps, the water buildup that i had my makeshift system in for, drained and did not come back.  EUREKA!!  Since this system has been in place, we continue to get the storms and flooding but my basement/crawlspace remain dry.  The system works as described and projected.  I cannot thank Dave and his team from AFS enough.  Their professionalism and concern to provide a solution to my problem was genuine and their work is top of the line. Dave's evaluation of my needs and his concern to present me with different options was genuine and without company profit in mind. I highly recommend this company and team for any issues you may have in basement or crawlspace area.  One happy customer...Mike Otto

resp.text: Mr. Otto, we are indeed pleased to hear that you are a happy customer! And, wow, thank you for sharing this with us. We are glad you had a great experience with Dave and that your basement/crawl space is dry now! Let us know if we can assist further - we'd be happy to.

name: Jeff Simmons
text:
I had mold and water seeping through my concrete block wall in basement. Due to hydrostatic pressure my walls were caving in slightly. I don’t remember the terminology  AFS uses but they came in and put what looks like a tarp over the walls.  It’s to prevent moisture and mold buildup. Life time warranty. It might be working but since my walls are covered up I am only guessing it is. After I removed everything from the walls in the basement, yes, everything, including taking out my bathroom, they jackhammered around the edge of the walls about a one foot trench. AFS then put in place , what I call a gutter. Rocks were placed around this gutter along with a moisture barrier and then concrete poured on top. Supposedly, they put holes into each concrete block on my wall and place  a pipe that goes from block to gutter. As you know, these blocks have cylinders inside where water can build up. The purpose is for water to drain from block(my wall)into the gutter then it’s to flow to corner of house where there is a sump pump.

Short story is that it’s been two years and no water has touched the sump pump. As you know the last two years have been like northwest Washington where we are getting tons of rain. Now I’m having moisture, called efflorescence, coming up where they jackhammered. AFS came by several times and put a sealer on floor. Never worked. Had another man come by and look at system to see if water was flowing properly; it was. I spoke to one of the managers and he stated there was nothing else they could do. I thought about legal action but statue of limitations had expired. $13k pretty much wasted and I’m left still trying to fix the problem.

resp.text:
Mr. Simmons,

We are sorry for your  frustration.  Making sure there is no confusion or frustration with any of our customers is vitally important to us.  We have a full time Service Department and Customer Care Club that serves no other purpose than to take care of our existing customers which you referenced with our previous visits to your home. That is something we put a lot of focus on.  If we miss you then please call us back but do look out for our call so that we can address your concern.

name: Ben Milam
text:
AFS Review

Before you read the rest of this, please know UPFRONT that the AFS rep notified us that they PRICE MATCH!  We found this out after we notified them we had a quote from another company.  This should throw up major “red flags” to anyone reading this. Why not give you their best price up front? Now read the rest if you would like.

Stay away from AFS if you plan on getting multiple quotes.  I LOVED everything they told me and was completely impressed by their upfront professionalism.  The representative came out, did a thorough inspection and gave us a detailed layout of what needed to be done.  Where things went bad was when it was discovered that we also had another company come out, providing comparable services for a moderately better price.  As a decent human, I felt it important to contact the AFS rep to inform him of our appreciation but we were going to go with a competitor. At that point he became a high-pressured salesman and became somewhat belligerent.  To top things off, we had filed a coverable insurance claim regarding a busted drain pipe and the insurance company contacted this AFS rep and the rep told them the problem was due to an issue that is well-known not coverable by insurance.  Had I not called the rep to inform him, man-to-man, of our decision and simply “ghosted” him (a cowardly way of handling things), we wouldn’t be in the predicament.  Through this behavior and revengeful tactics, he reassured us that AFS is not the type of company we want to take care of our home.  My wife and I are teachers and work on a limited budget...we would be silly to not request more than one estimate for a job this size.  A company such as this should realize that.

resp.text:
Mr. Milam,

We appreciate your kind remarks regarding the professionalism of our inspector.  We do try to be extremely detailed and responsible with both our inspections and repair plans.  Obviously we are disappointed when a homeowner chooses to use another company, but always want folks to make a decision that they’re comfortable with.

It sounds like there was some confusion regarding a possible insurance claim that you filed.  When asked by homeowners whether a crawlspace scenario is covered by insurance, our standard reply is that ‘it depends on your policy, it’s best to contract your insurance provider’.  While we’re not an insurance company, the trend that we have seen is that acute issues like a plumbing leak may be covered, whereas issues that develop over time, like ground water seepage are typically the homeowner’s responsibility – similar to hail damage to a roof vs a roof just wearing out.

The inspection photos of your crawl space showed a pattern of mud lines on multiple walls of your crawlspace.  This is consistent with a ground water seepage challenge and why our repair plan called for drainage and a sump pump in your crawl space.  If asked what was found in our inspection, our policy is just to be candid.  We can’t really speak to causality, but just to current conditions noted.

Hope this clears up any misunderstanding and we wish you the best with your repairs.

text: We purchased an older home that had foundation problems that led to cracking brick and a sinking garage floor.  After researching companies that dealt with this sort of problem we called AFS. They did great work, never slowed down in spite of the rain that made a mess of everything, were always friendly and open to questions, and cleaned up the muddy mess better than I ever hoped for.  A great team of professionals.  The second team led by Gavin Dendy installed the SettleStop foam to raise the garage floor back up and stabilize it.  It was amazing to watch and they made it look effortless.  Gavin explained the process and made sure we understood and were satisfied before wrapping up and leaving.  They also cleaned up after themselves and left the garage floor cleaner than it was when they got here.  I am completely satisfied with the work they did and would recommend them to anyone who has this sort of problem.  Great work guys!

name: Curtis Ballard
text:
I do not write reviews and do not like people who complain; however, I cannot stress enough how poorly this company performs their work.

I called them to fix 2 drainage problems; going out the back door of my house and the other was my driveway.  When it rained the water would not drain properly in both of these locations.  AFS said that their injection program would fix both of these problems; in reality it was the start of making things much worse.  They drill a bunch of holes in the concrete and inject some material that is supposed to raise the concrete; unfortunately the whole concept is flawed.  They cannot control where this material goes as it is injected under the concrete and they are unable to correctly monitor the pressure as it goes in.  AS a result my walkway in back and my driveway ended up cracked and tilted in such a way that the problem was much worse; the water was now more directed towards my house.
AFS tried to fix the driveway by cutting a 25 foot trench in my driveway and installing a drain; unfortunately this was also done incorrectly.  The slope of the drain did not allow the water to drain out, the drain was installed with large screws going into the drain pipe, which caught leaves creating a barrier.  Additionally, the cracks they created in the driveway and improper injection of the filler material caused my driveway to sag creating a lake that does not drain at all.
AFS tried to fix the drainage problem made worse by their injection program in back by digging up part of the walkway and replacing the concrete; unfortunately, again they did not get it right.  They did not provide the proper slope to the new concrete and as a result the water make another lake immediately up against the side of my house.
So now I have worse drainage problems, my driveway looks like hell and as a result of the drainage problems the corner of my house at the garage is sagging.
I would have been much better off if they had done nothing.

resp.text: Hello Mr. Ballard, we can certainly understand your frustrations.  We are normally known for providing the most professional installations and exceptional attention to detail.  However, we regret that we missed the mark.  I’m aware that our General Manager has reached out and set up a visit with you for this Monday to address your concerns.  We thank you for the opportunity to make this right.  Have a great day Mr. Ballard.

name: John Davis
text: Very dissatisfied with the whole experience.  Had them sand blast the floor joists.  Coverage was so bad, I had to call them back and the still didn't get everything.  Also, when they removed the HVAC main duct to sand blast, which was originally suspended with metal straps, they reinstalled it using vinyl straps (and apparently not enough of them).  The weight of the main broke the straps within the first year, and the entire main is lying on the ground.  I'm appalled that they want to charge me hundreds of dollars to fix their own negligence.  I'd expect much better quality of service after spending $16,000

resp.text: Hey John, would you mind emailing your contact information to info@afsrepair.com?  We want to address this but are having difficulty pulling your information up.

name: jerake lolake
text: Nothing but pain dealing with this company.  I had to do all of the initial leg work, getting the salesman to call me back, make a quote, calling in every time - not one callback from anyone, not being listened to at all.  I had put down a deposit on some work - after the schedule date was changed without my knowledge (no one knows how that happened) I decided to cancel the work since I can't trust them.  The salesman said I would get my deposit back - no confirmation, nothing from the company at all.  I called in, shows nothing about any return of deposit.  I get the "someone will call you back" but no one ever does.  Stay far far away from this company, I'm sorry I tried to do business with them.

It is our understanding that you are now in contact with our regional manager. If you have other questions or need assistance, please reach back out to him for assistance.

text:

Gil & Jean Lowden of Fort Payne Alabama....

name: Jackie Campbell
text:
My husband and I were very concerned when our home began developing cracks in the sheet-rock.  It began slowly and over the years several cracks developed throughout our home.  We knew we needed to get something done to stabilize our foundation since our home is built on clay soil with a high-water table. I googled and researched different companies and contacted AFS along with others to come out and give us an estimate.  AFS proved to be the most dependable and reliable; AFS actually showed up on the date and time they were scheduled.  Michael Rosewarne was our certified foundation repair specialist.  He was excellent.  I was very impressed with Michael's knowledge and ability to make me understand what was going on with our home.  He showed me pictures and drew a diagram of what we needed for repair; he was very thorough.  He is a super nice person and is an amazing communicator.  Even after the fact, I called him, and he was very gracious, patient, and kind to walk me through activating my account with Greensky.   Our foundation repair team arrived as scheduled calling along the way to let us know their ETA.  Matt Fernandes and his crew were fantastic, super friendly, honest, and very respectful.  Matt explained everything he and his team would be doing.  Matt showed me pictures of everything they had done.  They did a superb job working diligently until they got the job exactly as it should be.  They left everything neat and in order.  I think most of the cracks in our home are already closing.  Kudos to Matt and his team.  Michael also contacted me after the work was completed making sure we were happy with the results.
AFS is clearly a great company known for its integrity because of the great people working for them, Michael Rosewarne and Matt Fernandes along with his team.

resp.text: Jackie, thank you for taking the time to write this detailed review! We are glad you had such a good experience from beginning to end with AFS! Please let us know if we can be of any further assistance going forward.

name: April Moore
text: Just wanted to leave a review on a sweet employee I met over the weekend. I was shopping in Walmart on Winchester Rd. and made small talk with a lady I saw wearing an AFS shirt. I've seen the building on Jordan Rd. several times and wondered what exactly you did. . So I asked her if she worked there. She told me she was in customer service and so we got to talking about what your company offered. I was just being curious. We stood there I know for over 10 minutes going back and forth. I decided to write you because it hasn't left my mind how passionate and proud she was over her job.... You can tell she's invested in your company. I know that you may not get reports on employees but I felt you should know that she is wearing her shirt proudly. I wanna say her name is Jennifer. I remember she has a feather tattoo on her arm. I hope that anyone who needs help will call and speak to her.  Thanks!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words, April. We really appreciate you taking the time out to share your interaction with our team member Jennifer—and we agree, Jenn is truly an asset to our team and we are happy to have her!

name: Dean Cockrum
text: Arrived on time and left property clean. Second time I have used this company and would recommend it over others.

resp.text: Dean, thank you for the great feedback and the recommendation! We appreciate you taking the time to write this review.

name: Bruce Bentley
text: Put supports under my house, left a big mess under and outside of house. Called to come back and fix issues, they came back but before they left told me not to ever call them back. They do not stand begin their work. I still have problems with my floor. When you hear Afs run away as fast as you can.

resp.text: Mr. Bentley, we have responded to your concerns each time you have reached out since your original floor support installation June 2012. Our company has sent certified inspectors and crew members to your home and provided a thorough inspection of your floors, finding that they are indeed stabilized. We last reached out in 2017, offering to send a manager out to inspect the floors but you did not respond to our calls and voicemails. Although you have not responded to us reaching out, we are more than happy to come look at your floors, at no charge, even though your warranty expired in 2014. We absolutely stand behind our work and can be reached at 877-340-8479.

name: Larry G Hill Jr
text:
First, I will say that the crew was professional, efficient and did an excellent job. 5 stars for the crew. The Inspector/salesman was knowledgeable and made a sales pitch, but it lacked a few details. Like telling me someone had to be present on the 1st day during the soda blasting because they needed access to the inside of the house. The whole process seemed well coordinated for them. But, well-coordinated for them doesn’t necessarily mean well-coordinated for me and I felt they were partially responsible for that due to the lack of key information and poor initial inspection. I'd give 2.5 stars if I could

When I signed up, I thought I signed up for a thorough crawlspace inspection. What my Inspector did was gather just enough information about my crawlspace to fit into his sales pitch. It’s probably best to do your own crawlspace inspection before you even call them out, because you may have to perform repairs before their crew comes out. They DO NOT employ plumbers, carpenters or electricians to handle possible crawlspace issues. They just want to sell you their system and once you sign that contract you can’t back out without paying a 15% restocking fee.

After the Inspector performed his inspection at my place, I found and had to deal with several issues. In accordance with the contract I was responsible for making sure there was power available in the crawlspace for the dehumidifier. When I go into the crawlspace to take care of this I see a wet spot from 15 feet away and realize I have a water leak. A closer look revealed I had water damage. I point blank asked that Inspector if he saw anything that required immediate attention and he said “No”. There’s no way he should have missed this. The “Inspector” did come out and look at it and he did put me in touch with a carpenter, whom I did use, and I was able to get a plumber out quickly. But, with the expense of these repairs I would have liked to have pushed out the AFS work just to let my pocket book recover and make paying for the AFS work a little less taxing. He seemed to balk at the suggestion.

Back to the power I was installing. I asked specific questions about the dehumidifier they were going to install. Where did they need power? How long is the cord for the dehumidifier? What type of plug? Etc… What he didn’t tell me was they needed 2 outlets for the job. I assumed 1 spot to plug in the dehumidifier would be sufficient, so I cleaned up an existing power connection for the sump pump in my crawlspace, making sure to leave them a spot to plug in the dehumidifier. When the crew came out on the first day they informed me they need a 2nd outlet for the pump that goes with the dehumidifier, so I’m left scrambling that night to install another outlet.

It turned out I also had a strange issue with my AC ductwork that the AFS crew reported to me on the 1st day. I’ll give the Inspector a break here and say he may or may not have discovered this if he had performed the type of inspection I expected. This turned into yet another unexpected expense on top of the carpenter and plumber. It would have been nice if the Inspector had caught all of this. I would have preferred to take care of these 3 major issues before scheduling AFS. They still would have got my business, it just would have been pushed out a month or so. The experience just left a few things to be desired. Time will tell if the work holds up.

resp.text: Hi Mr. Hill, we would like to thank you for giving our installation crew a 5 star rating.  However, we would like to apologize for your negative experience with the inspector’s initial visit.  We have a high standard of quality for providing a complete and thorough inspection, and your home should not have been an exception.  We would like the opportunity to discuss this further with you.  Please call 256-880-0670 to speak with our General Manager, we will reach out to you as well.  Thank you Mr. Hill, and have a great day.

name: Ann Marie Lang
text: AFS has done a great job on our 70 year old house several times! Dan Gordon and Gavin did a fabulous job making sure all went well! I appreciate their help and professionalism over the years!

resp.text: Thank you for continuing your service with AFS throughout the years; we truly appreciate the feedback and rating you gave our representative and crew members. We value you as a customer and appreciate your trust in our company. Michael is a great Inspector with years of experience and we are glad that he continues to provide you with great service. Francisco, Jordan and Javier work extremely hard to provide the best installation and we appreciate the great feedback on their work. Thank you again Ann for choosing AFS.

name: Robert McManus
text: We had a fairly major water issue in our crawl space at Smith Lake and I called multiple companies.  After talking to all of them and with price being a big factor, I went with the company and really the person that I trusted.  AFS is a very large company, unlike most local companies, that has the ability to stand behind what they do for the long term.  I didnt want to have to worry about one of the smaller companies going out of business and/or not giving me the ability to get to someone other than the small business owner to address issues.  Lance Archer at AFS, who has been in this business for a very long time and lives in the immediate area, was very helpful.  More than helpful, actually.  I've never had experience with anything like this before so I needed someone that could teach me what I didnt know and someone I trusted fully and Lance was that person and AFS was the company I believed could stand by their work, forever!  They are very competitive and Lance is very trustworthy.  I highly suggest anyone contact him directly to get your work done!  If you need a reference, ask Lance or someone at AFS to give you my contact information and I'd be more than happy to talk to you!  Thank you, Robert McManus

resp.text:
Mr. McManus,
Thank you for this!  Each point that you noted is exactly what we want our customers to walk away with once we have met with them and worked with them.  We are not who we are without people like you reaching out to us and allowing us to work on their home.  Thank you for taking the time to leave a review and rating. Welcome to the AFS family.

name: Michael Robinson
text: Justin, Brandon, & Gavin

resp.text: Hi Michael! We appreciate you taking the time to share this review. We'll be sure to share with each team member! - AFS Foundation & Waterproofing Specialists

name: Joe Jackson
text: Keith Laney promised to inspect a property I was buying on Wednesday . Keith has not responded to my text. A week and a half later (still no reply) I call Jennifer at AFS. I told her what happened and asked for another inspector. resp.text: Thank you for the great rating and review Charles! We are happy to hear that Francisco, Matt & Jose performed up to your expectations and were careful with your property. We truly appreciate your trust in our company and for allowing us to improve and protect your foundation. Thank you!

name: Carlos Fletcher
text:
It's been a year. I can't see where they fixed my problem, actually I think they just took $13,000 dollars from me. Called them out here 3 times and I still have water under the house, and the worker evidently turned the humidifier off alongwith the alarm, to pacific me! Terrible expensive experience, I should have spent less money revamping my yard 😡😡😡😡😡😡

This company need more competition! They returned and did some extended work but I still put out sand bags to keep water from getting under the house. Payed $13,000 and they haven't returned to service the equipment not one time! I thought they would for the first year, but I guess I've got to buy into the service plan. More money. But there's a lifetime guarantee on the work. I guess I'm a single lady and I just don't get how this stuff works.

resp.text: Hi Mr. Fletcher, please give our office a call, we’d like to talk to you about the issues you stated above. We strive to make sure every customer is satisfied with the services. Please call our service department at your convenience, 877-340-8479.

name: Britney Walker
text: After dealing with some REALLY horrible foundation companies, David Flamm from AFS came to do an inspection of our home, and he was a breath of fresh air. He spent 2+ hours inspecting the inside, outside, and underneath our house. He gave us a very detailed report, then came out again on the weekend just to talk to my husband and show us short videos of how the products work. He was very professional, and you could tell he really cares about his customers. We hired AFS to do some work and needless to say, when you come home and see your yard/front porch torn up, you might start to panic. However, the onsite crew put my mind at ease and assured me once they put the top-of-the-line helical piers in, they would restore the concrete, landscaping, mulch, etc. exactly how it was before (or until I was 100% satisfied) at no extra cost. They lived up to their word, and what even impressed me more was that they finished the entire job in a single day. These guys are such honest and hard workers! You can tell the whole AFS team is well-trained. Keep up the good work!

resp.text: Mrs. Walker, we greatly appreciate your feedback, as well as your trust in AFS to complete your foundation repair project! We are happy to hear that you've had a remarkable experience with David, the installation crew, and our company as a whole. name: Robert Hendrix
text:
I contacted AFS not knowing much about the company, except what I was exposed to on TV and the internet. I needed work done on my house foundation and my son-in-law of Huntsville Heating and cooling, Christopher Hayden said that he had heard the company did good work.
David Rathmann of AFS responded to my call and we discussed what needed to be done and he explained the ins and outs of how it could be done and then let me make the decision on what I thought I needed and he made suggestions along the way. So it was decided I would have the work done.
On the two days the pier crew arrived, the crew chief Javier greeted me and we discussed the work progress and what they were doing each day.  Javier was ready to explain anything I was unsure about, with a short discussion on my expectations he and his crew was ready to get started. I have been around crews, and know how hard it is to get everyone going but without hesitation the crew was assigned work and they really got started. Along the way as I watched each of the crew was ready to explain what they were doing and why. It was great to see a crew that was self starting and knew their job so it could be accomplished with little delay. The second day the crew members changed a bit, but still  Javier was the crew chief, and again they started work soon after they arrived without delay and some conversations occurred at times to make sure what they were doing was the right way, because the situation of this repair was a little unusual, but they adapted to keep the work on time and with a professional attitude.
The third day the poly crew chief,  Dendy and crew arrived on time and immediately Dendy greeted me and explained what they were here for and ask to be shown the work area.  We discussed what he was going to do and how it would be accomplished and without delay, they got started preparing for the job of the day. They were always willing to explain the procedure and the expected results, and also how they would attempt to prevent any unwanted results.
I want to commend all the personnel for their excellent work and their professionalism and accepting my sometimes unneeded suggestions and allowing me to express myself.
Thank you AFS for having happy crews, apparently they like working for AFS and proudly say so with a strong sense of belonging to a company who apparently cares about their employees.

Robert Hendrix
A  Satisfied Customer.

resp.text: Mr. Hendrix, we greatly appreciate your feedback, as well as your trust in AFS to complete your repair project! We are in the business to take care of our customers and are glad to hear about your satisfaction from the beginning to the end of your project. We are happy to hear that you've had a remarkable experience with your Inspector, Dave; Foreman, Javier; Poly Foreman, Gavin and our company as a whole. We welcome you to the AFS family and are here if you need any assistance in the future. Thank you.

name: Beasley Cullen
text:
On 4/12/21, BDry came to install their waterproofing system along one wall of our basement that floods during heavy rain. After walking down the job and inspecting the crawl space, Chris spoke with his boss and determined that the issue we had was not a water problem but a leaking sewer pipe. He brought this to our attention and recommended for us to seek a plumber before going any further with the waterproofing.

The installer could have very easily said nothing and went on with the job. This speaks very highly of the character and integrity this company has. I would highly recommend this company to anyone needing this type of work.

text: Very professional and value added service to my home.  I chose Bdry to stabilize a corner foundation issue, remedy a water in crawl space problem and then decided to also do an encapsulation. name: Jennie Cochren
text: BDry has terrible communication problems scheduling between their construction contractor and them. We had a lot of problems with our house we had no choice but pull out of the contract. They swear that they will give your money back when thing doesn’t go right but that’s a lie. Their contractor came out and didn’t finish the demolition in our basement due to finding out more issues with our wall. When we finally had to make a decision not go forward with them and  we asked for our deposit back. It took them more a month to even get the refund processed. Every time I call the salesman, all I hear is excuses and blaming on their office. I was very frustrated for run around. Finally someone from their office calls back to me and to tell my they are only refunding very small portions of my deposit back. Their excuse was their construction people finished the demolition so they’re charging the full price. Like I said in the beginning, Demo was not finished. I try to tell them that this is wrong that they cannot charge me for something they didn’t finish. Construction people came out to do the demo for max 4-5 hours. I mean the was maximum hours. But yet they charged me thousands of dollars. I’m so upset and disgusted by their customer care. I would never ever recommend this company to anyone. Worst experience ever!!!!

resp.text:
Jennie,
I am very sorry to hear you had a poor experience with us at BDry. Please email us at bdryalabama@gmail.com so we can get you directly in touch with a manager and help make right any issues you have had during your experience. This is not up to our normal customer care standards.

name: tye-emily warren
text:
Not able to own their mistakes or own up to their mistakes ... even when we have video cameras!

James (electrician), Charlie (project manager) and Sammy (salesman/Liason) from B-Dry performed a $9,000 project on our basement. After asking them specifically to be careful so they do not affect the electrical of our dog fence, they damaged it the day they performed electrical work. Instead of owning up to their mistake, they denied it. Actually, they went beyond denying it and alleged WE must have done something.

Honesty and integrity are needed. Again, I absolutely do not recommend this company.

We were happy to hear that our waterproofing system has fixed your water issue after our monthly customer follow up. We greatly appreciate your business and stand behind our lifetime warranty in any future events of system failure. name: Patrick Bailey
text: The owner and workers were very nice. Was DEFINITELY the best of 3 quotes and was glad to hear about the "Gravity System" so no need for a pump install. I did alot of work myself to prepare for the job. Took down walls, studs, and anything in the way on the entire perimeter of my basement (1800 sq ft home). I also dug out a trench from my house to the edge of the yard (3ft deep by 1ft wide by 15ft long) for the drainage pipe. Had a grate installed on the front of my garage doors so no more water comes in garage. I had definitely been getting water coming in through the ground and was evident by the mold on the blocks in the garage before the system was in place. I have to say now almost a year later I haven't had a single drop come inside when it used to come in any time it would rain. However, I have periodically checked and have never seen the water come out of the drain pipe outside no matter how much or how hard it rains. I honestly don't know where the water is going but it's not coming inside. The reason BDry gets 3 stars is that the overall job works but is not 100%-I don't know where the water goes, the perimeter jackhammer/ concrete fill job isn't smooth and has cracks. The water drain panels put inside are wavy and needed to be more secure. The trim pieces weren't put in but left for me to do so it doesn't look like it should. Was about a 10k investment, I just hope that water isn't eroding my foundation underneath. I still smell wetness at times of rain aswell. I love the product and idea just not 100% at ease with install.

resp.text: Hi Patrick, BDry has been providing customers a lifetime warranty for the life of the structure on waterproofing systems for over 60 years. If you have any concern with the integrity of your system, we would love to schedule our experienced service tech to test your system. Any necessary repairs due to the failure of our system will be at no charge to you. You can reach our office today at 205-942-1976. We look forward to hearing from you!
